table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: The Recharge package is used to simulate a specified flux distributed over the top of the model and specified in units of length/time. Within MODFLOW, these rates are multiplied by the horizontal area of the cells to which they are applied to calculate the volumetric flux rates.

li.link: Harbaugh, A.W., Banta, E.R., Hill, M.C., and McDonald, M.G., 2000, MODFLOW-2000, the U.S. Geological Survey modular ground-water model -- User guide to modularization concepts and the Ground-Water Flow Process: U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 00-92, 121 p.

li.text: Harbaugh, A.W., 2005, MODFLOW-2005, the U.S. Geological Survey modular ground-water model -- the Ground-Water Flow Process: U.S. Geological Survey Techniques and Methods 6-A16.
The Well package is used to simulate a specified flux to particular cells specified in units of length

The Flow and Head Boundary package can be used to simulate a specified flux to particular cells specified in units of length

Recharge is applied to the wrong cells because
was not set correctly.
Precipitation is assumed to be equal to recharge
Recharge is applied at that are unreasonable when compared with the hydraulic conductivity.
The
package simulates recharge so the RCH package is not normally included in a model that includes the
package or at least not in the same locations.

li.link: Methods for Estimating Groundwater Recharge In Humid Regionslink to recharge web page

li.text: Recharge is not the same as precipitation. Recharge includes only that portion of the precipitation that actually reaches the water table. Evapotranspiration from the unsaturated zone is not included in recharge. Recharge may also include flow into groundwater from streams or rivers if that flow is not included in the model in some other way.

para.text: Input to the Recharge (RCH) Package is read from the file that has type "RCH" in the
file. All single-valued variables are free format if the option “FREE” is specified in the Basic Package input file; otherwise, the variables have 10-character fields.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Item 0 is optional—“#” must be in column 1. Item 0 can be repeated multiple times.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Text—is a character variable (199 characters) that starts in column 2. Any characters can be included in Text. The “#” character must be in column 1. Except for the name file, lines beginning with # are restricted to these first lines of the file. Text is printed when the file is read.
This optional item must start with the word “

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NPRCH—is the number of recharge parameters.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NRCHOP—is the recharge option code. Recharge fluxes are defined in a layer variable,
, with one value for each vertical column. Accordingly, recharge is applied to one cell in each vertical column, and the option code determines which cell in the column is selected for recharge.

li.text: 1—Recharge is only to the top grid layer.
2—Vertical distribution of recharge is specified in layer variable
3—Recharge is applied to the highest active cell in each vertical column. A constant-head node intercepts recharge and prevents deeper infiltration.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IRCHCB—is a flag and a unit number.

li.text: If IRCHCB > 0, it is the unit number to which cell-by-cell flow terms will be written when "SAVE BUDGET" or a non-zero value for ICBCFL is specified in Output Control.
If IRCHCB
0, cell-by-cell flow terms will not be written.

para.text: Repeat Items 3 and 4 for each parameter to be defined (that is,
If PARNAM is to be a time-varying parameter, the keyword INSTANCES and a value for NUMINST must be entered.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PARNAM—is the name of a parameter to be defined. This name can consist of 1 to 10 characters and is not case sensitive. That is, any combination of the same characters with different case will be equivalent.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: PARTYP—is the type of parameter to be defined. For the RCH Package, the only allowed parameter type is RCH, which defines values of the recharge flux.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NCLU—is the number of clusters required to define a parameter. Each repetition of Item 4b is a cluster (variables
). There is usually only one cluster used to define a RCH non-time-varying parameter or instance of a time-varying parameter; however, it is acceptable to have more than one cluster.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: – is an optional keyword that designates a parameter as time varying. The keyword is case-insensitive; that is, it may be entered in any combination of upper- and lower-case letters. If INSTANCES is present, it must be followed by a value for NUMINST. If
is absent, PARNAM is non-time-varying and NUMINST should not be present.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: NUMINST – is the number of instances that are included in the definition of a time-varying parameter, where each instance is a series of NCLU clusters. If the keyword INSTANCES is present, NUMINST must be present and must be at least 1. If the keyword INSTANCES is absent, NUMINST should not be present.
repetitions of Item 4 (parts a and b) are read. After each repetition of Item 4a,

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: INSTNAM – is the name of an instance associated with parameter

specified in the corresponding Item 3. The name can consist of 1 to 10 characters and is not case sensitive. That is, any combination of the same characters with different case will be equivalent. Names entered for INSTNAM must be unique for any given parameter, but names may be reused for instances associated with different parameters.
times. Each repetition of Item 4b is called a parameter cluster. The
repetitions of Item 4b follow each repetition of Item 4a when

para.text: to be used to define cell values that are determined by a parameter. The name “
” means that there is no multiplier array, and the cell values will be set equal to

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: to be used to define the cells that are associated with a parameter. The name “
” means that there is no zone array, and all cells in the layer are associated with the parameter.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IZ—is up to 10 zone numbers (separated by spaces) that define the cells that are associated with a parameter. These values are not used if Zonarr is specified as “
.” Values can be positive or negative, but 0 is not allowed. The end of the line, a zero value, or a non-numeric entry terminates the list of values.

para.text: read flag. Its function depends on whether or not parameters are being used.

li.text: If no parameters are being used (
If INRECH
³
0, a layer variable of recharge fluxes,
, is read.
If INRECH < 0, recharge rates from the preceding stress period are used.
If parameters are being used (
If INRECH > 0, INRECH is the number of parameters that will be used to define
in the current stress period. Item 7 defines the names of the parameters.
If INRECH < 0, recharge parameters from the preceding stress period are used.
INRECH = 0 is not allowed. That is, when parameters are used, at least one parameter must be specified each stress period.

0, a layer variable of layer numbers (
) is read.
If INIRCH < 0, the variable (

para.text: Either Item 6 or Item 7 may be read, but not both. If Item 7 is read, it is repeated INRECH times.

para.text: Pname—is the name of a parameter that will be used to define the
variable in the current stress period. Read

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Iname – is an instance name that is read only if Pname is a time-varying parameter. Multiple instances of the same time-varying parameter are not allowed in a stress period.

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IRCHPF—is an optional format code for printing the
variable after it has been defined by parameters. The format codes are the same as those used in the

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:0px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; cell-border-width:0px; border-style:none; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: IRCH—is the layer number variable that defines the layer in each vertical column where recharge is applied. Read only if
is greater than or equal to zero.
